instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touchbar. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
Board looked very clean other than the touchbar connector (J4402 now removed due to pin 20 and 22 being corroded/shorted.

It has all power rails, CPU gets warm, with no Post, No chime, no display.
Really stuck. anything i should check?

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touchbar. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: These do not chime, so very possible it is just working without display. Connect external LCD to check first. Or connect a USB mouse and see if light comes on. Yes you will need to get some USB-C adapters and yes just get the official Apple ones so we are not wasting time with incompatible Chinese junk.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touchbar. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 37010"]These do not chime, so very possible it is just working without display. Connect external LCD to check first. Or connect a USB mouse and see if light comes on. Yes you will need to get some USB-C adapters and yes just get the official Apple ones so we are not wasting time with incompatible Chinese junk.[/QUOTE]

I will check external. But i get no keyboard backlight as just assumed it wasnt doing anything.
Ive tested the screen/ screen cable with another board, and they are good. but i will rebuild the system and see if i get anything on an external.

Already have all the correct adapters for USB-C /USB and external displays.
